subject: Re: [junit] Should JUnit determine if assert*/fail is called in testFoo?
msgSnippet: ... maybe pubic void testMethod() { try { Obj.method( abc ); } catch (Exception e) { fail( shouldn t throw any exception ); } } better tells what you want to
messageBody:
> there are some cases when it's "ok" to have no assert* or fail. For example:
>
> public void testMethod() {
> Obj.method("abc"); //test that it does not throw anything and accept
> the param.
> }

maybe

pubic void testMethod() {
try {
Obj.method("abc");
} catch (Exception e) {
fail("shouldn't throw any exception");
}
}

better tells what you want to test.

-Vladimir
